intro: Sopubia mannii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Sopubia mannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
